intro: Thamnocharis esquirolii, commonly known as the Esquiroli's thamnocharis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
